news.headline: Private payroll growth in January misses expectations as market awaits official jobs data
news.article_text:
US private employers added fewer positions than anticipated last month, according to the private payroll processor ADP, starting 2026 off on a downbeat note.

Private payrolls grew by just 22,000 in January, ADP said Wednesday, below economists' expectations of 45,000 positions.

The tally for last year was perhaps an omen.

news.headline: Four Days Left Until Blackstone Inc. (NYSE:BX) Trades Ex-Dividend
news.article_text: Readers hoping to buy Blackstone Inc. (NYSE:BX) for its dividend will need to make their move shortly, as the stock is about to trade ex-dividend. Typically, the ex-dividend date is one business day before the record date, which is the date on which a company determines the shareholders eligible to receive a dividend. The ex-dividend date is an important date to be aware of as any purchase of the stock made on or after this date might mean a late settlement that doesn't show on the record date.

news.headline: The Story of American TV Shows, From ‘I Love Lucy’ to ‘Stranger Things’
news.summary: The first American television drama was “The Queen’s Messenger,” a filmed play broadcast to sets with 3-inch screens placed throughout the city of Schenectady, N.Y., in 1928.  The first continuing American TV sitcom was the DuMont network’s “Mary Kay and Johnny” in 1947—the same year that also brought the earliest shows geared at children, in “Kukla, Fran and Ollie” and “Howdy Doody.”  This domestic sitcom, starring Lucille Ball as a frustrated housewife and Ball’s then-husband Desi Arnaz as her patient bandleader husband, is the most influential show in TV history, and it isn’t close.

news.headline: Four Days Left Until Blackstone Inc. (NYSE:BX) Trades Ex-Dividend
news.article_text: Readers hoping to buy Blackstone Inc. (NYSE:BX) for its dividend will need to make their move shortly, as the stock is about to trade ex-dividend. Typically, the ex-dividend date is one business day before the record date, which is the date on which a company determines the shareholders eligible to receive a dividend. The ex-dividend date is an important date to be aware of as any purchase of the stock made on or after this date might mean a late settlement that doesn't show on the record date.

news.summary: A  KKR  -led consortium has agreed to acquire a Singapore data-center company valued at $10.9 billion, marking the U.S. firm’s largest Asia-Pacific infrastructure investment yet as the AI frenzy fuels demand for tech assets.  The group of investors, which includes Singapore telecommunications company  Singtel  will buy the rest of ST Telemedia Global Data Centres not already owned from its parent, the companies said Wednesday.  The KKR-led group already owns a minority stake in STT GDC that it acquired from parent ST Telemedia for $1.3 billion in 2024.

news.headline: The Story of American TV Shows, From ‘I Love Lucy’ to ‘Stranger Things’
news.summary: The first American television drama was “The Queen’s Messenger,” a filmed play broadcast to sets with 3-inch screens placed throughout the city of Schenectady, N.Y., in 1928.  The first continuing American TV sitcom was the DuMont network’s “Mary Kay and Johnny” in 1947—the same year that also brought the earliest shows geared at children, in “Kukla, Fran and Ollie” and “Howdy Doody.”  This domestic sitcom, starring Lucille Ball as a frustrated housewife and Ball’s then-husband Desi Arnaz as her patient bandleader husband, is the most influential show in TV history, and it isn’t close.
